main: ^Do you know an active volcano here in the Philippines?

c-0: ^Yes! One of these are Mt. Pinatubo.
^Do you mind telling me some of its info?
^Sure! Mt. Pinatubo is an active stratovolcano in the Zambales Mountains. Pinatubo's 1991 eruption is the 2nd largest eruption of the 20th century.
^Pinatubo was spewing 10 billion tons of ash and rocks during its eruption. The lahar sank entire villages and infrastructure in Zambales, Tarlac, Pampanga, and all agricultural provinces.
^Fine ash from the eruption fell as far away as the Indian Ocean and satellites tracked the ash cloud as it traveled severaltimes around the globe.
^That's all! If you want to recap some of its info. Just let me know.
